page.title: 17The Limeburners' Arms
page.content: The Limeburners' Arms is the village pub. It is owned and run by Mr.W. Moore. Its name refers to the fact that this area was a lime burning district in the past. Roughly eighty percent. of the customers come from this village, whilst the others are mainly workmen. The most popular drink is beer, but soft drinks and pop are also available. For{recreation }you can play darts or dominoes, but dominoes is on Friday night only. There is also a darts club. Only one room is used by the public. This is the bar. It can hold approximately thirty-five people. In this room there is a television but no juke box. The pub is situated opposite a telephone box on the main road. It is close to G.E. Moore's Haulage Company.
